Surrogate Test

Source: R/plotFUN.R
plotSUR_hist.Rd

Surrogate Test

Usage

plotSUR_hist(
  surrogateValues,
  observedValue,
  sides = c("two.sided", "greater", "less")[1],
  binWidth = NULL,
  measureName = "",
  title = "",
  doPlot = TRUE,
  returnOnlyPvalue = FALSE
)

Arguments

surrogateValues

Vector of measures based on surrogate time series

observedValue

The measure obtained from the observed value

sides

Is this a 1 or 2-sided test (default = 1)

binWidth

The size of the histogram bins. The default is to look for the max. number of digits and set the width to 1/10^(Ndigits-1). If integers are detectec width will be set to 1.

measureName

Label for x-axis

title

A title for the plot

doPlot

Plot a histogram of the distribution (default = TRUE)

returnOnlyPvalue

Do not return the graph, just the point p-value (default = FALSE)

alpha Significance threshold for the test. This value is currently calculated from the data as \(\frac{1}{rank}*Nsides\), setting it will not have an effect.

Value

A point p-value for the observed value, and/or a histogram of the distribution (ggplot2 object).
